div.p: From Carl Wilhelmi to William Hooker
RBG Kew, Directors' letters, vol. LXXIV, Australia letters 1851-8, no. 235.

Your friendly letter from the 26 of October '56 I received at the end of March '57 on my return from my excursion I have delayed until now to reply to your above letter, hoping that Dr. Mueller would have been back here long since and that he would have in that case described the plants found in my Expedition. Dr. Mueller was here in February but returned the same month to Sydney to put in order his business there, but now according to his last advises he will not definitely return to Melbourne before the End of June [...]
The remainder of Wilhelmi’s letter describes his excursion to the Grampians, Victoria Ranges & Pyrenees with his assistant Dr. Schenk. A post-script asked for plants of 'Cyperus Papirus' (sic) to introduce into the lagoon of the Botanical Garden.
